sentence.Network_en: The officer stamped his boot. "Don't be insolent with me, mademoiselle."
sentence.Network_cn: 军官跺跺靴子：“小姐，别对我无礼。”

sentence.Network_en: The bandit bared his teeth in an insolent smile.
sentence.Network_cn: 那匪徒龇牙咧嘴地狞笑.

sentence.Network_en: Well, he had shown the insolent fellow the door.
sentence.Network_cn: 哼, 他已经把那个傲慢无礼的家伙赶走了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (also in the sense 'extravagant, going beyond acceptable limits'): from Latin insolent- 'immoderate, unaccustomed, arrogant', from in- 'not' + solent- 'being accustomed' (from the verb solere)

entry.def: If you say that someone is being insolent, you mean they are being rude to someone they ought to be respectful to.

example.ex: The officer stamped his boot. 'Don't be insolent with me, mademoiselle.'
example.tran: 军官跺跺靴子：“小姐,别对我无礼。”

sentences.sentence: "the student was kept in for impudent behavior"
"the most bodacious display of tourism this side of Anaheim"- Los Angeles Times
"the modern world with its quick material successes and insolent belief in the boundless possibilities of progress"- Bertrand Russell

auth_sentence.content: With all the vaunt and insolent port of a conqueror.
auth_sentence.res_content: With all the vaunt and insolent port of a conqueror.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: With all the vaunt and insolent port of a conqueror.

auth_sentence.content: Youths strolling past their headmaster with insolent unconcern.
auth_sentence.res_content: Youths strolling past their headmaster with insolent unconcern.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Youths strolling past their headmaster with insolent unconcern.

auth_sentence.content: Insolent or audacious in address; coolly impudent or presuming.
auth_sentence.res_content: Insolent or audacious in address; coolly impudent or presuming.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Insolent or audacious in address; coolly impudent or presuming.

sentences.en: At these insolent words her anger rose.
sentences.cn: 听了这些傲慢无礼的话,她冒火了。

sentences.en: His insolent manner really got my blood up.
sentences.cn: 他那专横的态度把我的肺都气炸了。

sentences.en: The bandit bared his teeth in an insolent smile.
sentences.cn: 那匪徒龇牙咧嘴地狞笑。

sentences.en: Well,he had shown the insolent fellow the door.
sentences.cn: 哼,他已经把那个傲慢无礼的家伙赶走了。
